page.title: 03Stretton Sugwas Gravel Pit
page.content: The pit is operated by Amey Roadstone Corporation (ARC), a subsidiary of Consolidated Goldfields International, on land owned by the Prudential Assurance Company. The deposits are of glacial origin. There is no blasting: materials are extracted by dragline and processed on site to produce medium and fine sand and gravel. The products are distributed widely, some to the building industry and some to roadworks. Extraction has gone on here since the 193Os, but because of the nature and origin of the deposits no reliable estimate exists of how long extraction will be profitable. A separate company producing ready-mixed concrete is sited at the pit for ease of access to the requisite materials. The total site covers about 16O acres. Some reclaimed land has been rented to a local farmer.
